text: use both this parameter and |birth_date to display the person's date of birth, date of death, and age at death) --> | death_place = | death_cause = | body_discovered = | resting_place = | resting_place_coordinates = | burial_place = | burial_coordinates = | monuments = | nationality = | other_names = | citizenship = | education = | alma_mater = St. Paul's Convent School St Edmund's School, Canterbury University of Edinburgh | occupation = Actress | years_active = 1984–2004 2009-2010 | era = | employer = | organization = | agent = | known_for = | notable_works = | style = | home_town = | salary = | net_worth = | height = | weight = | television = | spouse = | partner = Ole Scheeren (2007–2011) | children = | parents = | mother = | father = | relatives = | family = | callsign = | awards = | website = | module = | module2 = | module3 = | module4 = | module5 = | module6 = | signature = | signature_size = | signature_alt = | footnotes = }} Maggie Cheung Man-yuk (; born 20 September 1964) is a Hong Kong actress. She is known for her roles in As Tears Go By, Center Stage, Comrades: Almost a Love Story, Green Snake, The Soong Sisters, In the Mood for Love, and Clean. In 1983, Cheung entered the Miss Hong Kong pageant and won the first runner-up and the Miss Photogenic award as well. She was a semi-finalist in the Miss World pageant the same year. ==References== Category:1964 births Category:Living people Category:Models (profession) Category:Hong Kong actors
